extendedInfo.description: This fun app is the ultimate social party taboo style game that is now available on android.  If you are familiar with Charades, Catch Phrase and other similar word games then Can't Say That is for you.  Play with friends and family anywhere and any time.  No need to carry around a deck of cards and write scores and track the time, now its all in one device.  The game requires a minimum of 4 players to play.  Features:========================* 350+ cards. * Randomized decks, reshuffled at the start of each game* Fun graphics* Audio tones* Multiple decks* New words and decks are frequently addedCan't Say That is a social card game with multiple card decks to choose, ranging from biblical, standard to math decks.  The math card deck can also be used as an educational learning tool to teach math vocabulary to students.  Can't Say That is great for both kids and adults to play.  The biblical deck is perfect for bible study and other related events.  Can't Say That can be used to make education and learning fun for students.  RulesAn even number of players from four to ten sit alternating around in a circle. Players take turns as the "giver," who attempts to prompt his or her teammates to guess as many keywords as possible in the allotted time. However, each card also has "taboo" (forbidden) words listed which may not be spoken. Should the giver say one, a "censor" on the opposing team hits the buzzer and the giver must move on to the next word. For example, the giver might have to get his or her team to deduce the word "baseball" without offering the words "sport," "game," "pastime," "hitter," "pitcher," or "baseball" itself as clues. The giver may not say a part of a "taboo" word;[4] for example, using "base" in "baseball" is taboo. The giver may only use speech to prompt his or her teammates; gestures, sounds (e.g. barking), or drawings are not allowed. Singing is permitted, provided the singer is singing words rather than humming or whistling a tune. The giver's hints may not rhyme with a taboo word, or be an abbreviation of a taboo word.While the giver is prompting the teammates they may make as many guesses as they want with no penalties for wrong guesses. Once the team correctly guesses the word exactly as written on the card, the giver moves on to the next word, trying to get as many words as possible in the allotted time. When time runs out, play passes to the next adjacent player of the other team. The playing team receives one point for correct guesses and one penalty point if "taboo" words are spoken.(from wikipediahttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taboo_(game))Disclaimer: ========================Can't Say That is not associated with Hasbro's Taboo, Tabu, TabÃ¹ products, registered trademarks.If you have any suggestions about the game, please contact the developer at henduoapps@gmail.com

reviews.title: Wow what a treat
reviews.comment: Yoo Daring Dudes Can\'t Say That is a Joyest Free Treat. Not only can you have mucho fun with it but also use it to impress the honies. Onces you paly it a few times it will come to you how to use it to make new friends of the oppisite sex if you know what I mean, Dean. Don\'t worry Pimping the square dudes will never figure it out so don\'t let them in on it. OG Chezzii
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best Game for Socials!
reviews.comment: Can\'t Say That is too much fun...if you like Taboo, but hate dragging around the big box...this is the game for you! There\'s a few kinks, but the developer stays on top of them. Download ASAP!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nicccee
reviews.comment: This app is GREAT, no glitches finally! I have an htc evo and it works great on my phone. I went ahead and bought the upgraded version for my  game night.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Better than taboo!!
reviews.comment: This is a wayyyy better version of taboo, its way more entertaining and easier to use, never going back to taboo after this one!
reviews.author: A Google User
